text:
<#CLJJXGTC0|local-development> - I am running into an error when trying to create a module using the local developer approach.

`hs create module AnyName`

yields

```CLI version: 3.0.5
node version: v14.16.0
platform: windows

Error: EEXIST: file already exists, mkdir 'C:\Development\Marketing\HubSpot\AnyName.module'```
This is a fresh install of NodeJS and Windows 10 Professional. I've tried variations where I specify the destination, with each demonstrating the same error.

Worth noting, it will create the folder, but none of the files that I am expecting within.

Installed the latest CLI version globally, but tried locally, producing the same results. Just getting kicked off with HS development overall, but so far the tutorials have not led me astray.  Appreciate the guidance.

Apologize for the dumb question but can you confirm that you don’t already have a folder at that location with the name “AnyName.module”? because it looks like it’s stating that it already exists at that location so it doesn’t want to make it.
